int-org-section.heading: Tourism

alt-heading.usage: casee sacac ass sasia fea eerca
casee sacac ass sasia fea eerca

address.verbatim-address: 99 Wall St, 1855, New York, NY 10036 USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote travel and tourism to Africa and to strengthen intra-Africa partnerships
holds an annual World Tourism Conference and Presidential Forums on Tourism
in 2010 signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the African Union
org-entry.stats: mems: 20 corps, 12 nat., and 40 allied cos

address.verbatim-address: 2 Chemin de Blandonnet, CP 111, 1215 Geneva 15, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: represents motoring orgs and touring clubs around the world
aims to study all questions relating to automobile mobility

address.verbatim-address: 501 E Las Olas Blvd, Suite 200/300, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1962 as the Caribbean Hotel Asscn, present name adopted in July 2008
org-entry.content-note: represents and promotes the hotel and tourism industry in the Caribbean region
jtly owns and operates, with the Caribbean Tourism Organization, the Caribbean Tourism Development Co
org-entry.stats: mems: 1,000 hotels and allied mems, 32 nat. hotel asscns
org-entry.content-note: publ. CHA Weekly News

address.verbatim-address: Baobab Tower, Ground Floor, Warrens, St Michael, BB 22026, Barbados

org-entry.found-date: 1989, by merger of the Caribbean Tourism Association (f. 1951) and the Caribbean Tourism Research and Development Centre (f. 1974)
org-entry.content-note: promotes tourism in the Caribbean region
organizes annual Caribbean Tourism Conference, Sustainable Tourism Development Conference and Tourism Investment Conference
conducts training and other workshops; provides scholarships and grants to Caribbean nationals to facilitate tourism, hospitality and languages studies

launched in 2014, with the OAS, SICA and other partners, the Americas Sustainable Destinations (SDAA) initiative, with the aim of strengthening public-private partnerships to protect, and to improve the lives of local people in, destination areas (Antigua and Barbuda, Bahamas, Barbados, Honduras, Nicaragua, Dominica and Jamaica)
in Sept. 2017 activated its CTO Relief Fund to assist relief and rehabilitation efforts in mem. countries affected by devastating hurricanes
in early 2022 launched the online Caribbean Tourism Institute, providing virtual learning and training
organized a Caribbean Sustainable Tourism Conference in April 2024, in Grenada
maintains offices in New York, USA and London, UK
reported in March 2024 that during 2023 overall tourist arrivals in the Caribbean had exceeded (pre-pandemic) 2019 levels by 0.8%
publs Caribbean Tourism Statistical News (quarterly), Caribbean Tourism Performance and Outlook Report (annually)

address.verbatim-address: 29 d rue de Talant, 21000 Dijon, France

org-entry.content-note: known as the European Cities Marketing until 2022, the alliance serves as a platform for the exchange of knowledge, best practices and business promotion; mems include European city or regional tourist boards, convention bureaux and city marketing orgs
organizes workshops, expert meetings, confs and a CityDNA summer school

address.verbatim-address: 5 Jungang-no, Chuncheon, Gangwon Prov., Republic of Korea

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the competitiveness of the regional tourism industry and to strengthen local govt through tourism and co-operation
promotes the devt and training of tourism personnel and information exchange; organizes tour events in mem. provinces
org-entry.stats: mems: 10 regional provinces in Cambodia, Indonesia, Japan, Lao People’s Democratic Rep., Malaysia, Mongolia, People’s Rep. of China, Philippines, Rep. of Korea, Viet Nam
org-entry.content-note: publ. Academic Symposium

address.verbatim-address: 61 rue du Marché aux Herbes, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: promotes and markets European destinations
conducts market intelligence and other research, and advocates for climate action and greater sustainability within the tourism industry
org-entry.stats: mems: 36 nat. tourist orgs in European countries, 16 assoc. mems
org-entry.content-note: publs Annual Report , European Travel Trends and Prospects (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Gate House, 2nd Floor, Fretherne Rd, Welwyn Garden City, Herts, AL8 6RD, United Kingdom

org-entry.found-date: 1932 as ­International Youth Hostel Federation, present name adopted in 2006
org-entry.content-note: facilitates international travel by mems of the various youth hostel asscns
advises and helps in the formation of youth hostel asscns in countries where no such orgs exist
org-entry.stats: mems: 60 asscns, comprising 2,650 youth hostels in 57 destinations; 3.3m. individual mems
org-entry.content-note: 13 assoc. nat. orgs
publ. Annual Report

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association for Medical Assistance to Travellers

address.verbatim-address: 10 Morrow Ave, #202, Toronto, ON M6R 2J1, Canada

org-entry.content-note: aims to improve and provide easy accessibility to medical assistance for international travellers, including advice on high-risk areas and prevention mechanisms
awards research grants and scholarships in the field of travel medicine
publ. online Medical Directory

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Antarctica Tour Operators

address.verbatim-address: 50 South County Commons Way, Unit E-5B, South Kingston, Rhode Island 02879, USA

org-entry.content-note: promotes safe and environmentally responsible travel to Antarctica
acts as a forum for private sector tour operators to share information and agree best practices
aims to foster co-operation between those operators and the international scientific community in the Antarctic
maintains a Ship Scheduler database
org-entry.stats: mems: 46 tour operating cos, 11 provisional operators, 45 assoc. mems, 7 non-profit assoc. mems

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Scientific Experts in Tourism

address.verbatim-address: Dufourstr. 40 a , 9000 St Gallen, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: encourages scientific activity in tourism, to support tourist institutions of a scientific nature and to organize conventions
publs The Tourism Review (quarterly), Conference Proceedings

address.verbatim-address: POB 15804, Honolulu, HI 96830, USA

org-entry.content-note: promotes the adoption of Green Growth strategies

address.verbatim-address: 5 ave Theodore Flournoy, 1207 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the interests of the international hospitality industry and to contribute to its growth, profitability and quality
membership extended to restaur­ants in 1996
org-entry.stats: mems: 242 hospitality asscns, 10 nat. asscns, 5 int. hotel and restaurant chains and 8 worldwide partners

address.verbatim-address: POB 821, Kasane, Botswana

org-entry.found-date: 2011, having been developed under the auspices of the Southern Africa Development Community
org-entry.content-note: promotes the sustainable management of the Kavango Zambezi ecosystem, the transfrontier conservation area’s cultural heritage, and local tourism
org-entry.stats: mems: Angola, Botswana, Namibia, Zambia, Zimbabwe

address.verbatim-address: True Digital Park, 101/1 Bang Chak, Phra Khanong, Bangkok 10260, Thailand

org-entry.content-note: aims to enhance the growth, value and quality of Pacific Asia travel and tourism
holds annual conf. and destination marketing forum (the PATA Travel Mart: Bangkok, Thailand, in Aug. 2024), and an annual forum with UNWTO (2024: Macao, SAR, in May)
divisional offices in Sydney, Australia and Beijing, People’s Rep. of China
org-entry.stats: mems: 82 govt, state and city tourism bodies, 14 int. airlines and airports, 71 hospitality orgs, 75 educational institutions
org-entry.content-note: publs research reports, directories, newsletters, blog posts

address.verbatim-address: FNPF Pl., Level 3, Victoria Parade, Suva, Fiji

org-entry.found-date: 1983 as the Tourism Council of the South Pacific
org-entry.content-note: undertakes sustainable activities and markets the South Pacific as a tourist destination
org-entry.stats: mems: 21 govts, some 200 private sector mems
org-entry.content-note: publ. Pacific Tourism Statistics

address.verbatim-address: London, United Kingdom

org-entry.found-date: 1992 to promote responsible sustainable practices in the hospitality sector
org-entry.content-note: aims to achieve `net positive hospitality’, focused on giving back to a destination more than is taken

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: United Federation of Travel Agents' Associations (UFTAA)

address.verbatim-address: Monte Carlo Sun, 74 blvd d’Italie, 98000 Monaco

org-entry.content-note: represents the interests of travel agents at international level
issues literature on travel
org-entry.stats: mems: reg. feds representing some 80 nat. asscns

address.verbatim-address: Place du Temple 4, 1096 Cully, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: aims to foster the devt of tourism and to aid the rational organization of tourism in all countries
collects and disseminates information, and participates in commercial and financial operations
org-entry.stats: mems: some 50 individual travel agencies in 45 countries

org-entry.usage: ewyb edio ass sacac sasia fea

address.verbatim-address: POB 1015, Canning Bridge, Applecross, WA 6153, Australia

org-entry.content-note: provides a forum for Indigenous groups to share experiences and protect and promote their interests within the tourism industry
advocates for Indigenous peoples wishing to develop responses to issues and opportunities arising from existing and proposed tourism devts and trends of global interest
inaugural World Indigenous Tourism Summit held in April 2018; 2nd: Perth, Australia, in March 2023

address.verbatim-address: The Harlequin Bldg, 65 Southwark St, London, SE1 0HR, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: prioritizes security and travel facilitation; the sustainable and inclusive devt of the travel/tourism industry; and crisis preparedness, management and recovery
researches and analyses the impact of tourism on employment levels and local economies and promotes greater expenditure on tourism infrastructure
promotes best practices and destination stewardship
maintains an online Consumer Travel Hub, focused on the social benefits of responsible travel
implements a Women’s Initiative, focused on promoting gender equality in the sector

in April 2023 the WTTC reported that the global travel and tourism economy had grown by 24.7% in 2021 and by 22% in 2022, and that in 34 countries the sector had exceeded its performance in (pre-pandemic) 2019
the sector was reported to have provided 295m. jobs in 2022 (compared with 334m. in 2019 and 264m. in 2020)
holds an annual Global Summit (2023: Kigali, Rwanda, in Nov.)
publs Travel and Tourism Review , regional and country reports, roadmaps, economic impact research data
